CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Insider Risk Management - Granular exclusion
CurrentVersion.description: ,Granular exclusion allows admins to adjust and fine tune indicators according to organizational preferences to help tailor the detection of risks that may lead to a potential security incident. For example, admins can configure the indicator “sending email with attachments to recipients outside the organization” to only detect emails sent to personal domains (e.g., outlook.com). In that way, admins can reduce the number of false positives. Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider Risk Management enables customers to create policies to manage security and compliance. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy. Note: The cloud environments have been updated to show the current state.  We apologize for any incovenience this may cause.

CurrentVersion.title: SharePoint: Content Pane for SharePoint Pages and News.
CurrentVersion.description: The content pane surfaces relevant authoring tools that help authors quickly browse and add content to SharePoint pages. With this new feature, authors can easily drag and drop web parts, media, and section templates for creating rich and engaging pages.

OldVersion.title: SharePoint: Content Pane for SharePoint Pages and News.
OldVersion.description: The content pane surfaces relevant authoring tools that help authors quickly browse and add content to SharePoint pages. With this new feature, authors can easily drag and drop web parts, media, and section templates for creating rich and engaging pages.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Recurring task lists and top task publishing requests
CurrentVersion.description:
Task publishing allows an organization to centrally define and distribute tasks across their frontline locations and monitor how that work is going. The task publishing capability will allow users to create recurring task lists that repeat on a selected cadence, to create lists assigned to everyone in a recipient team, to require a Microsoft Forms form as a prerequisite to completion, and to designate an approval as a prerequisite to completion.
More info: https://support.microsoft.com/office/publish-task-lists-to-create-and-track-work-in-your-organization-095409b3-f5af-40aa-9f9e-339b54e705df

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Task publishing: Schedule recurring lists in task publishing
OldVersion.description:
The task publishing experience in Microsoft
Teams is a feature for frontline organizations that have employees distributed
across many geographically dispersed locations. The task publishing feature
allows an organization to centrally define a set of work, choose the set of
frontline locations that should complete that work, create the appropriate
tasks for each frontline location, and monitor how that work is going. One of
the top feature requests for task publishing has been the ability to create a
set of tasks once and set them to automatically repeat at a scheduled cadence.
Common examples are daily opening and closing tasks or weekly/monthly site
inspections and compliance walks. When this feature is available, you'll be
able to set recurrence on a draft task list, which will allow you to choose the
cadence (such as every month on the 15th of the month). You can then publish
the list and task publishing will take care of scheduling the publication so
that the list publishes automatically at that cadence going forward. We know
from a wide range of customer conversations that this will be a big time saver
for distributing recurring tasks across frontline organizations.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Communication Compliance – User scoping role-based access control (RBAC)
CurrentVersion.description: ,Delegate management and remediation authority for different people in different regions or organization units with role-based access control (RBAC).For example,– German investigators should be able to investigate messages for only German users; German administrators can only create/manage policies for only German users. Microsoft Purview Communication Compliance provides the tools to help organizations detect regulatory compliance violations (e.g. SEC or FINRA), such as sensitive or confidential information, harassing or threatening language, and sharing of adult content. Built with privacy by design, usernames are pseudonymized by default, role-based access controls are built in, investigators are opted in by an admin.

OldVersion.description: Delegate management and remediation authority for different people in different regions or organization units with role-based access control (RBAC).For example,– German investigators should be able to investigate messages for only German users; German administrators can only create/manage policies for only German users. Microsoft Purview Communication Compliance provides the tools to help organizations detect regulatory compliance violations (e.g. SEC or FINRA), such as sensitive or confidential information, harassing or threatening language, and sharing of adult content. Built with privacy by design, usernames are pseudonymized by default, role-based access controls are built in, investigators are opted in by an admin.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Communication Compliance - User scoping role-based access control (RBAC)
CurrentVersion.description: This introduces delegate management and remediation authority for different people in different regions or organization units with role-based access control (RBAC). For example, German investigators should be able to investigate messages for only German users, and German administrators can only create/manage policies for only German users.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Communication Compliance - User scoping role-based access control (RBAC)
OldVersion.description: This introduces delegate management and remediation authority for different people in different regions or organization units with role-based access control (RBAC). For example, German investigators should be able to investigate messages for only German users, and German administrators can only create/manage policies for only German users.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: Controls for enterprise secure AI
CurrentVersion.description:
,
The Microsoft Edge management service will give admins the controls to manage settings for Enterprise AI features, including Copilot in Edge.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: Controls for enterprise secure AI
OldVersion.description:
,
The Microsoft Edge management service will give admins the controls to manage settings for Enterprise AI features, including Copilot in Edge.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: Inactive teams and inactive domains report export capability
CurrentVersion.description: Admins will be able to export the inactive teams and inactive domains reports to a csv file in Teams Admin Center.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention- Enriched Data Loss Prevention Alert Email Notifications for DLP Admins
CurrentVersion.description: ,There is now increased information in the alert email notification sent to the Data Loss Prevention (DLP) admin upon a DLP policy match. Previously a DLP alert email only included the user activity and the type of sensitive information matched in the alert. Now, DLP admins will get additional context such as alert ID, policy details, device details, and more. This will help admins quickly assess the priority of an alert and determine the next steps before navigating to the Microsoft Purview DLP alerts page or Microsoft 365 Defender DLP alerts page.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: Data Loss Prevention- Enriched Data Loss Prevention Alert Email Notifications for DLP Admins
OldVersion.description: ,There is now increased information in the alert email notification sent to the Data Loss Prevention (DLP) admin upon a DLP policy match. Previously a DLP alert email only included the user activity and the type of sensitive information matched in the alert. Now, DLP admins will get additional context such as alert ID, policy details, device details, and more. This will help admins quickly assess the priority of an alert and determine the next steps before navigating to the Microsoft Purview DLP alerts page or Microsoft 365 Defender DLP alerts page.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: New VDI solution for Teams
CurrentVersion.description: New VDI solution for Teams is a redesigned version of the existing VDI solution, providing enhanced performance, reliability, and security. It offers additional features such as advanced meeting capabilities and a simpler app update experience for users. This Roadmap entry applies to Windows endpoints connecting to Azure Virtual Desktops, Windows 365 and Citrix VDI environments only.

OldVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: New VDI solution for Teams
OldVersion.description: New VDI solution for Teams is a redesigned version of the existing VDI solution, providing enhanced performance, reliability, and security. It offers additional features such as advanced meeting capabilities and a simpler app update experience for users. This Roadmap entry applies to Windows endpoints connecting to Azure Virtual Desktops, Windows 365 and Citrix VDI environments only.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Aggregated Reactions Count in Message List in new Outlook for Windows and web
CurrentVersion.description: We will be showing the count of Reactions aggregated across all items in the conversation in the Message List. This new feature will be available on Outlook on the web and the New Outlook for Windows.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Teams: External domain activity report export capability
CurrentVersion.description: Export the ‘External domain activity’ report to a csv file in Teams Admin Center.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Edge: Customize organization branding in Edge for Business
CurrentVersion.description:
Admins can customize their organization's branding assets onto Edge for Business. Admins can enable and configure branding onto profile-related UI for profiles signed in with an Entra ID (formerly known as Azure Active Directory) account. You can configure your organization’s details such as name to the profile pill; name, logo, and brand color to the profile flyout; and logo to overlay the Edge for Business taskbar icon. This branding can help users more easily differentiate between multiple profiles and browser windows. The Microsoft Edge management service will give admins an enhanced experience to control, preview, and customize assets. Admins can control organization branding through the following policies: OrganizationColor, OrganizationLogo, OrganizationLogoOnAppIcon, OrganizationName.
More info: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-for-business#company-branding

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: Right preview pane in the single line view aka column layout
CurrentVersion.description: Adding support to show the reading pane in the right when user selects column view.

CurrentVersion.title: Outlook: New Outlook for Windows - Search tasks using Microsoft To Do
CurrentVersion.description: ,Search across your tasks lists using the Microsoft To Do module in Outlook on the web and the new Outlook for Windows.

CurrentVersion.title: Microsoft Purview compliance portal: The new Microsoft Purview Portal entering GA
CurrentVersion.description: The new Microsoft Purview portal has a streamlined design and unified experience that helps you discover and access data security, data governance, and risk and compliance solutions for all your data, wherever it lives across your data estate. This means you can now access all Purview solutions in one single portal, as well as experiences such as settings, global search, recommendations, and roles and permissions management.
